alert.note: Alert for Hall; Harlan; Kearney; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 10:33PM CDT until August 26 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Adams, Franklin, Hall, Harlan, Kearney and Webster. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1030 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have already fallen in much of the Advisory area, and an additional 1 to 2 inches is possible yet tonight. - This includes, but is not limited to, the following streams and drainages... South Branch Sand Creek, West Fork Farmers Creek, Thompson Creek, Lovely Creek, Little Cottonwood Creek, East Branch Thompson Creek, Thirtytwo Mile Creek, Sand Creek, Pawnee Creek,Turkey Creek, Big Cottonwood Creek, West Branch Thompson Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Middle Branch Thompson Creek, Ash Creek, Scott Creek, West Branch Thirtytwo Mile Creek, Center Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Grand Island, Franklin, Kenesaw, Doniphan, Juniata, Campbell, Holstein, Upland, Bloomington, Prosser and Norman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
